Ingredients.2: 1 pound flat iron steaks, cut into small pieces

Ingredients.8: 1 (15 ounce) can black beans, drained and rinsed

Ingredients.10: 1 (12 ounce) bag tortilla chips, or to taste

Directions.1: Spray a frying pan with cooking spray. Heat over medium heat. Cook and stir steak until barely any pink remains, 5 to 7 minutes. Drain fat from pan; add taco seasoning to the steak. Let simmer until desired consistency is reached, 3 to 5 minutes.

Directions.2: Warm milk in a medium saucepan over medium heat until small bubbles appear along the sides. Remove from heat.

Directions.3: Melt butter in another medium saucepan over medium-high heat. Add flour once bubbles disappear. Cook, stirring constantly with a whisk, until mixture becomes paste-like and light golden brown, about 5 minutes. Gradually whisk in the warm milk and bring to a simmer over medium heat. Cook and stir until the mixture is thick and smooth, 10 to 15 minutes. Reduce heat to low and stir in shredded cheese.

Directions.4: Add black beans, salsa, and the steak pieces. Stir and serve with tortilla chips.
